solution_line_template: First find the total time Ellen spends painting lilies: {time_per_lily} minutes/lily * {num_lilies} lilies = <<{time_per_lily}*{num_lilies}={total_time_lilies}>>{total_time_lilies} minutes
Then find the total time Ellen spends painting roses: {time_per_rose} minutes/lily * {num_roses} roses = <<{time_per_rose}*{num_roses}={total_time_roses}>>{total_time_roses} minutes
Then find the total time Ellen spends painting orchids: {time_per_orchid} minutes/orchid * {num_orchids} orchids = <<{time_per_orchid}*{num_orchids}={total_time_orchids}>>{total_time_orchids} minutes
Then find the total time Ellen spends painting vines: {time_per_vine} minutes/lily * {num_vines} vines = <<{time_per_vine}*{num_vines}={total_time_vines}>>{total_time_vines} minutes

Then add the amount of time Ellen spends on each type of flower to find the total time: {total_time_lilies} minutes + {total_time_roses} minutes + {total_time_orchids} minutes + {total_time_vines} minutes = <<{total_time_lilies}+{total_time_roses}+{total_time_orchids}+{total_time_vines}={total_time}>>{total_time} minutes
